metadata.name: Southern Gothic #267
metadata.description:
“Southern Gothic” is my debut release on the fxhash platform. The project is created entirely through code. All copyrights are released to the holder of each image output, even for commercial purposes.

“Southern Gothic” borrows its name from the literary genre made famous by writers like Flannery O’Connor and Carson McCullers. Rather than illustrating a singular setting, the code generates an entire rural townscape, thereby, blurring the boundaries between representation and narrative. The individual scenes are framed frontally with an intentionally flat aesthetic character, referencing traditional folk art of the American South. The absence of human figures within these scenes adds to their overwhelming sense of darkness and forlorn. Observing multiple scenes side-by-side, one may even get the strange feeling that something terrible has happened (or is about to happen) in this rural landscape.

Pressing the down arrow saves the coded output as a .png image.

metadata.name: Word-eating worms #91
metadata.description:
Audiovisual generative artwork.

An old letter recounts the problems and feelings caused by woodworms: worms known to eat not only the beams and wood of houses, but also old books. As an analogy to this daily occurrence, emoticons appear and with the good spirit of simplifying they begin to gnaw away so much literary flourish.

The piece puts in counterpoint two forms of communication: emoticons and traditional writing. Here an inevitable contrast is sought between the standardization of the feelings of emojis, and the excessive flourishes of texts, possibly already from other times.

Original flute (tap & frullato), cello (pizz) and marimba samplers.
((click to start sound))

[s] -> save 2160x2160px (in live view)

metadata.name: Orchard #305
metadata.description:
A natural media rendering of a fruit tree during one of the four seasons. Sometimes, you'll catch it at night - with lights strung on the tree!

The amount of color in spring and fall, snow in winter, fruit on and off the tree will all vary. There are four spring bloom palettes, four trunk colors, and seven types of fruit. 

Press ’s’ to save a screenshot. Image size is 1000x1000px
Press ’p’ to pause/resume.

To render a variation at a new size, open live view and append '?size=#' to the end of the URL. The new size may be from 100 to 3,000. This version will not be a 1:1 match to your edition but will have all of the same features.

Copyright (c) 2022 Matt Perkins, hello@mattperkins.me, @nudoru on Twitter. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Whisper #396
metadata.description:
Abstract forms built with noise and texture

-------------

A note on rendering times: *Whisper has a lot going on*. It can take up to 1-5 minutes to fully render, depending on your hardware configuration, including a 15sec-1min loading phase during which lots of calculations take place (but no visuals). It'll get there, just be patient! A small loading bar along the bottom also shows the progression of the render during the drawing phase.

Press 'S' or click "Save image" to save a PNG version of the artwork while in full-screen/IPFS view

Customisation
-------------

The following parameters can be adjusted in full-screen mode.
Open the token in full-screen/IPFS mode, and add any of these to the URL:

&size=2000 (replace 2000 with any value up to around 8000) - this sets the resolution/width of the canvas in pixels. Use this to generate very large PNG images (50MB+) suitable for printing at large DPI & canvas sizes. The max value here is dependent on your hardware, might not work on mobiles etc.

&ratio=1.4 (any value between 1 and 2, default = 1.4) - set the aspect ratio of the work. By default Whisper renders at 1:1.4 but you can change this to match other printing formats. Different ratios will produce slightly different outputs, but the overall character of the artwork should still be present. Landscape mode is not supported.

metadata.name: A Watch #123
metadata.description:
Another adventure in narrated horology: this work features entirely new texts, authored by AI that I trained on a set of novels. Each minute is an AI prose output, a fragment of a novel that doesn't exist, generated from the time itself.

The form factor is ideal for smaller window sizes and displays, although it will scale to any size. With the right device, you could probably wear it on your wrist.

Nearly 5,000 unique text templates are included, many of which feature variable character names, for which I sourced approximately 1.8 million possible first names and 150,000 possible surnames from U.S. Census data: https://github.com/rossgoodwin/american-names

I wanted to provide just enough text for each minute so that you could read the whole excerpt before the minute ends, though you might need to read briskly. None of the passages have been edited manually, and some remain quite glitchy, as intended. You may recognize a few motifs or proper names here and there, depending on the books you're familiar with, but each passage remains wholly original otherwise.

Each edition features either a linear or nonlinear text sequence:

Nonlinear editions will all show one of two possible template texts for each minute, and will read like fragments from multiple (strange and glitchy) novels. Nonlinear sequences feature independently generated texts, with variable character names unique to each minute of each edition.

Linear editions will all show the same template text for each minute, and will read like (strange and glitchy) 24-hour novels. For linear sequences, I utilized a generative prompting technique in which each minute's text is generated partially from the text of the minute before it. Variable character names for linear sequences are unique to each edition and repeat throughout the day.

Aesthetic possibilities for each edition include 16 color palettes, 8 fonts, 7 depths, 5 types of numerals, and 3 types of hands. Some editions have color-accented second hands and minute marks, while others appear more static and minimalist, without any numerals or second hand at all.

This token relies on p5.js for the clockwork, vanilla JS for the text.



Double click to toggle fullscreen.

Push `d` to download current minute's text as a .txt file.

metadata.name: REIN #221
metadata.description:
REIN

A generative approach to personal interpretation of reincarnation

It is not my right and job to prove the existence of reincarnation, but the concept makes a good dialogue for my heart and also is a fun challenge for my brain.

1. About the role:

The element on the screen is basically the metaphor for every object/person in your current life.

As the ACTOR, you can make choice under your instant willingness and travel in this world with limited time.

As the OBSERVER you can watch the above and question and dialogue with the ACTOR and alter its choice.

2. About the visualizations:

In order to present our big world in a limited 2D graphical approach. I shrink the dimensions and the detail of the existing reality.

Humans and Objects are dots, 3D entities like us become tiny dots (zero dimension) on a 3D space where their activity is backward translated to 2D perspective coordinates

Interactions between two entities are lines, and in our world planes or shapes were formed when interactions involved multiple people or objects. Which becomes an event.

We now as observer from the higher ground can witness the events’ change, progress, and karma by the continuous growth of the plane into various shapes.

Every world we reincarnated back into will have a visual color and an audio color tone. It is considered to be the theme of that particular life.

The final composition becomes a mix of the above, everything is merely the same but everything yet looks different. Depends on your perspective."

3. Some personal sharing thru creating REIN:

Life is short - I am happy if you are feeling annoyed and you feel the screen comes and fades so fast. Indeed this is my personal feeling about life, too short and things ended before you realize it.

Some life is super long and boring - I am also happy if you felt so. So sing and discover your song of life when you are in the room. It happens once only with this combination.

No time to prepare/predict/prejudge - but you can enjoy cause you/he/she/it/they/we will end in here suddenly. So enjoy the up and down, sweet and sour of every bit.

There is always an intangible target and goal preset to you, and it cast a line between you and it. You can choose to ignore it or be actively chasing it. But no matter which choices you made, your locus was left and shown in front of your eyes.

4. Observer’s responsibility and award
This work inspires me that in life we can both be the actors/actress and also the observer.

What matters more to you?
The background, your choice, or both?
Are you the observer guy who sits and doesn’t move?
Are you moving towards the [goal] linking with you? Do you keep chasing it?
Are you caring about the background more? Do you have a feeling they somehow related to you?
Or do you simply move your life freely without caring about the other happening?
Your voice is too loud or not?
Will you find the background noise too loud?
What can you do with it?
If the target connected to you is hollow and empty, would you still care about it?

And Why? Why do you feel so?
Which part of the above dialogue is related to your existing life?
What can we do/change/keep?
What you really can control?"


// [Click] - The sound of the work can be muted by clicking again the screen
// [s] - Take a selfie of this world and you inside
// [spacebar] - you can stop the time and walk/think freely like NEO in the matrix

Behind [REIN]
As a generative artist, I force myself to seek the possible ways to use these tools/skills/presentation forms.

In Traveler, it is about finding the difference between being alone and feeling loneliness
In FEA, it is about possibilities
In BULLET, it is about courage and faith
In REIN, I hope we can treasure what we lost and gained.

Art to me can be the visualization of aesthetics or a mutually enjoyable creative process for you and me.

Or like this time in REIN.

A journey towards our room inside our heart shape box.

metadata.name: Southern Gothic #34
metadata.description:
“Southern Gothic” is my debut release on the fxhash platform. The project is created entirely through code. All copyrights are released to the holder of each image output, even for commercial purposes.

“Southern Gothic” borrows its name from the literary genre made famous by writers like Flannery O’Connor and Carson McCullers. Rather than illustrating a singular setting, the code generates an entire rural townscape, thereby, blurring the boundaries between representation and narrative. The individual scenes are framed frontally with an intentionally flat aesthetic character, referencing traditional folk art of the American South. The absence of human figures within these scenes adds to their overwhelming sense of darkness and forlorn. Observing multiple scenes side-by-side, one may even get the strange feeling that something terrible has happened (or is about to happen) in this rural landscape.

Pressing the down arrow saves the coded output as a .png image.

metadata.name: twofiftythousand #259
metadata.description:
twofiftythousand is about the chaos of unlimited decisions. Look for a pattern in the noise.

Press 's' to save an image while in full-screen mode.

If you want to increase the resolution of the saved image, add e.g. &size=2000 after the live/fullscreen view URL to render the canvas at that specific pixel width (default = browser sized). This will be dependent on your system specifications, but outputs of up to 8000px wide, or above, should be possible.

metadata.name: Art blocks II #200
metadata.description:
Art Blocks II was built on a dynamic grid system. Blocks with random colors and sizes represent the poetic aesthetics of generative art and the harmony of randomness. This collection is composed of 11 different grid sizes and 4 different patterns of backgrounds with more than 150 color palettes. There will be a roughly 14% chance of getting colorful gradients in the work.

This collection works the best in full size. Enlarge it to see the details :)

- Press "s" to save the image in 4800 × 3200

metadata.name: BLEND #980
metadata.description:
BLEND is a minimal generative artwork drawn in a 8px by 8px canvas.
Three pixel square layers of different sizes are drawn on top of each other and blended to create a variety of compositions that range from colourful to monochromatic, from symmetric to unexpected or from pixelated matrices to more blocky shapes.

The token implements 4 random features:
- the color palette, there are 20 of them, each composed of 4 colors
- the colors subset, a range of 2 to 4 colors picked from the palette
- blend mode, one of multiply, overlay, hard light, soft light or color burn
- the order in which the three layers (small, medium, large) are drawn on top of each other

Controls (in live view):
- Press the [s] key on the keyboard to save a PNG file of the token. You'll be asked at which resolution you would like to save file in case you want something bigger then the original 8px by 8px canvas.
